Fungal infection.description: Fungal infection is a common skin condition caused by fungi.
Fungal infection.precautions: Bath twice, use detol or neem in bathing water, keep infected area dry, use clean cloths.
Fungal infection.medications: Antifungal Cream, Fluconazole, Terbinafine, Clotrimazole, Ketoconazole

Allergy.description: Allergy is a hypersensitive reaction of the immune system to a usually harmless substance.
Allergy.precautions: Identify and avoid triggers, use antihistamines if necessary, keep emergency medication available.

GERD.description: GERD is a chronic condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation.
GERD.precautions: Avoid trigger foods, eat smaller, more frequent meals, avoid lying down after eating, raise the head of your bed.
GERD.medications: Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs), H2-receptor blockers, Antacids

Chronic cholestasis.description: Chronic cholestasis is a condition where bile flow from the liver slows or stops.
Chronic cholestasis.precautions: Maintain a healthy weight, avoid alcohol, avoid unnecessary medications.

Drug Reaction.description: Drug reaction is an adverse reaction to medication.
Drug Reaction.precautions: Avoid the triggering medication, seek medical attention if severe symptoms occur.
Drug Reaction.medications: Depends on the type and severity of the reaction, often involves stopping the medication and supportive care.

Peptic ulcer disease.description: Peptic ulcer disease is a sore that develops on the lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus.
Peptic ulcer disease.precautions: Avoid smoking, limit or avoid alcohol consumption, avoid nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).
Peptic ulcer disease.medications: Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs), H2-receptor blockers, Antacids, Antibiotics (if caused by H. pylori infection)

AIDS.description: AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome) is a chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
AIDS.precautions: Practice safe sex, use clean needles, get tested regularly for HIV, take antiretroviral therapy (ART) as prescribed.

Diabetes.description: Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects how your body metabolizes sugar (glucose).
Diabetes.precautions: Monitor blood sugar levels regularly, follow a healthy diet, engage in regular physical activity, take medications as prescribed.
Diabetes.medications: Insulin, Metformin, Sulfonylureas, DPP-4 inhibitors, GLP-1 receptor agonists, SGLT2 inhibitors, Thiazolidinediones

Gastroenteritis.description: Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically resulting from bacterial or viral infection.
Gastroenteritis.precautions: Stay hydrated, rest, avoid spicy or fatty foods, practice good hygiene to prevent spreading the infection.

Bronchial Asthma.description: Bronchial asthma is a chronic inflammatory condition of the airways, characterized by episodes of wheezing, breathlessness, chest tightness, and coughing.
Bronchial Asthma.precautions: Avoid triggers such as allergens and irritants, use inhalers as prescribed, have an asthma action plan, get regular check-ups.
Bronchial Asthma.medications: Short-acting beta agonists (SABAs), Long-acting beta agonists (LABAs), Inhaled corticosteroids, Leukotriene modifiers, Oral corticosteroids

Hypertension.description: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a common condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
Hypertension.precautions: Follow a healthy diet, maintain a healthy weight, exercise regularly, limit alcohol intake, manage stress, take medications as prescribed.
Hypertension.medications: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, Angiotensin II receptor blockers (ARBs), Calcium channel blockers, Beta blockers

Migraine.description: Migraine is a neurological condition characterized by recurrent episodes of severe headache, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
Migraine.precautions: Identify and avoid triggers, maintain a regular sleep schedule, manage stress, stay hydrated, take medications as prescribed.
Migraine.medications: Acute medications (Triptans, NSAIDs, Ergotamines), Preventive medications (Beta blockers, Antidepressants, Anticonvulsants)

Cervical spondylosis.description: Cervical spondylosis is a degenerative condition of the cervical spine (neck) characterized by wear and tear on the spinal disks and vertebrae.
Cervical spondylosis.precautions: Maintain good posture, practice neck exercises, use proper ergonomics, avoid activities that strain the neck.
Cervical spondylosis.medications: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Muscle relaxants, Corticosteroid injections, Physical therapy

Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).description: Paralysis resulting from brain hemorrhage occurs when bleeding in the brain damages brain cells, leading to loss of muscle function.
Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).precautions: Seek immediate medical attention, follow rehabilitation program as prescribed, make lifestyle modifications to reduce risk factors for stroke.
Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).medications: Depends on the underlying cause and symptoms, may include blood thinners, anticonvulsants, pain relievers.

Jaundice.description: Jaundice is a yellowing of the skin and eyes caused by excess bilirubin in the blood.
Jaundice.precautions: Treat underlying cause, maintain hydration, rest, avoid alcohol and medications that can worsen liver function.
Jaundice.medications: Depends on the underlying cause, may include antiviral medications, corticosteroids, supportive care.

Malaria.description: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by parasites of the Plasmodium genus.
Malaria.precautions: Use insect repellent, sleep under mosquito nets, take antimalarial medications if traveling to high-risk areas.
Malaria.medications: Antimalarial medications (e.g., Chloroquine, Artemisinin-based combination therapies)

Chicken pox.description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection characterized by an itchy rash with small, fluid-filled blisters.
Chicken pox.precautions: Stay home, avoid close contact with others, keep skin clean and dry, take medications to relieve itching and fever.
Chicken pox.medications: Antiviral medications (e.g., Acyclovir), Antihistamines, Acetaminophen (for fever and discomfort)

Dengue.description: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing a severe flu-like illness, and sometimes leading to potentially lethal complications.
Dengue.precautions: Prevent mosquito bites by using insect repellent, wearing protective clothing, and using mosquito nets.
Dengue.medications: Supportive care for symptoms, such as pain relievers, fluids, rest. Avoid NSAIDs as they can increase bleeding risk.

Typhoid.description: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, usually spread through contaminated food and water.
Typhoid.precautions: Practice good hygiene, drink clean water, eat thoroughly cooked food, get vaccinated if traveling to high-risk areas.
Typhoid.medications: Antibiotics (e.g., Ciprofloxacin, Azithromycin), Fluid replacement therapy

Hepatitis A.description: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious viral infection of the liver, typically spread through contaminated food or water.
Hepatitis A.precautions: Practice good hygiene, wash hands thoroughly, avoid contaminated food and water, get vaccinated.
Hepatitis A.medications: Supportive care for symptoms, no specific antiviral medications.

Hepatitis B.description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease.
Hepatitis B.precautions: Practice safe sex, avoid sharing needles or personal items, get vaccinated.

Hepatitis C.description: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage.
Hepatitis C.precautions: Avoid sharing needles, practice safe sex, avoid alcohol, get tested for hepatitis C if at risk.
Hepatitis C.medications: Direct-acting antiviral medications (e.g., Sofosbuvir, Ledipasvir, Ribavirin)

Hepatitis D.description: Hepatitis D, also known as delta hepatitis, is a liver infection caused by the hepatitis D virus, which requires hepatitis B virus for replication.
Hepatitis D.precautions: Get vaccinated against hepatitis B to prevent hepatitis D, avoid behaviors that increase risk of hepatitis B infection.
Hepatitis D.medications: No specific antiviral treatment for hepatitis D, supportive care for symptoms.

Hepatitis E.description: Hepatitis E is a liver disease caused by the hepatitis E virus, typically spread through contaminated water.
Hepatitis E.precautions: Practice good hygiene, drink clean water, avoid consuming undercooked meat, get vaccinated if available.
Hepatitis E.medications: Supportive care for symptoms, no specific antiviral medications.

Alcoholic hepatitis.description: Alcoholic hepatitis is liver inflammation caused by excessive alcohol consumption.
Alcoholic hepatitis.precautions: Abstain from alcohol, seek treatment for alcohol dependence, follow a healthy diet, avoid medications that can further damage the liver.

Tuberculosis.description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs but can also affect other parts of the body.
Tuberculosis.precautions: Take medications as prescribed for the full course of treatment, practice good hygiene, avoid close contact with others until no longer contagious.

Common Cold.description: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, usually caused by rhinoviruses.
Common Cold.precautions: Practice good hygiene, wash hands frequently, avoid close contact with sick individuals, get plenty of rest, stay hydrated.
Common Cold.medications: Over-the-counter cold remedies (e.g., decongestants, pain relievers, cough syrups)

Pneumonia.description: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, causing cough with phlegm, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing.
Pneumonia.precautions: Get vaccinated against pneumonia, practice good hygiene, avoid smoking and exposure to smoke, seek prompt medical attention for respiratory symptoms.
Pneumonia.medications: Antibiotics (e.g., Amoxicillin, Azithromycin, Levofloxacin) if bacterial, Antiviral medications if viral, Corticosteroids (in severe cases)

Dimorphic hemorrhoids (piles).description: Dimorphic hemorrhoids, also known as piles, are swollen veins in the lowest part of your rectum and anus.
Dimorphic hemorrhoids (piles).precautions: Maintain good bowel habits, eat high-fiber foods, avoid straining during bowel movements, keep the anal area clean and dry.
Dimorphic hemorrhoids (piles).medications: Over-the-counter hemorrhoid creams, suppositories, and pads, Pain relievers, Fiber supplements

Heart attack.description: A heart attack, also known as myocardial infarction, occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart muscle is blocked, typically by a blood clot.
Heart attack.precautions: Seek emergency medical attention immediately, take prescribed medications (e.g., aspirin), make lifestyle changes to reduce risk factors for heart disease.
Heart attack.medications: Aspirin, Thrombolytics, Beta blockers, ACE inhibitors, Statins, Nitroglycerin

Varicose veins.description: Varicose veins are enlarged, swollen, and twisted veins, usually occurring in the legs and feet.
Varicose veins.precautions: Exercise regularly, elevate legs when resting, avoid sitting or standing for long periods, wear compression stockings.
Varicose veins.medications: Over-the-counter pain relievers, Compression stockings, Procedures to remove or close veins

Hypothyroidism.description: Hypothyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone, leading to various symptoms such as fatigue, weight gain, and cold intolerance.
Hypothyroidism.precautions: Take thyroid hormone replacement medication as prescribed, follow a balanced diet, manage stress, get regular exercise.

Hyperthyroidism.description: Hyperthyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone, leading to symptoms such as weight loss, rapid heartbeat, and anxiety.
Hyperthyroidism.precautions: Take medications as prescribed to reduce thyroid hormone production, avoid excessive iodine intake, manage stress, get regular exercise.
Hyperthyroidism.medications: Antithyroid medications (e.g., Methimazole, Propylthiouracil), Beta blockers

Hypoglycemia.description: Hypoglycemia is a condition characterized by abnormally low blood sugar levels, often occurring in individuals with diabetes who take medications that lower blood sugar.
Hypoglycemia.precautions: Eat regular meals and snacks containing carbohydrates, monitor blood sugar levels frequently, carry glucose tablets or gel for emergencies.
Hypoglycemia.medications: Glucose tablets or gel, Glucagon injection (for severe hypoglycemia)

Osteoarthritis.description: Osteoarthritis is the most common form of arthritis, characterized by the breakdown of cartilage in the joints, leading to pain, stiffness, and swelling.
Osteoarthritis.precautions: Maintain a healthy weight, exercise regularly to strengthen muscles and improve joint flexibility, use joint protection techniques.
Osteoarthritis.medications: Over-the-counter pain relievers, Topical creams or gels, Corticosteroid injections, Hyaluronic acid injections, Joint supplements (e.g., glucosamine, chondroitin)

Arthritis.description: Arthritis is a broad term that refers to inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain, stiffness, and swelling.
Arthritis.precautions: Maintain a healthy weight, exercise regularly, use joint protection techniques, apply heat or cold therapy, consider assistive devices.
Arthritis.medications: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), Corticosteroids, Biologic agents

(Vertigo) Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo.description: Paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) is a common cause of vertigo, characterized by sudden, brief episodes of spinning dizziness triggered by changes in head position.
(Vertigo) Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo.precautions: Avoid sudden head movements, use caution when changing positions, perform specific head maneuvers as prescribed by a healthcare professional.
(Vertigo) Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo.medications: Antihistamines, Benzodiazepines (for severe cases), Vestibular rehabilitation exercises

Acne.description: Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells, resulting in pimples, blackheads, and cysts.
Acne.precautions: Keep skin clean, avoid picking or squeezing pimples, use non-comedogenic skincare products, maintain a healthy lifestyle.
Acne.medications: Topical retinoids, Benzoyl peroxide, Salicylic acid, Oral antibiotics, Oral contraceptives (for females), Isotretinoin (for severe cases)

Urinary tract infection.description: Urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, ureters, and urethra.
Urinary tract infection.precautions: Stay hydrated, urinate frequently, practice good hygiene, wipe from front to back, avoid irritating products.

Psoriasis.description: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition that causes the rapid buildup of skin cells, resulting in red, scaly patches that may itch or burn.
Psoriasis.precautions: Keep skin moisturized, avoid triggers such as stress and certain medications, use gentle skincare products, avoid scratching or picking at plaques.
Psoriasis.medications: Topical corticosteroids, Topical retinoids, Vitamin D analogues, Immunosuppressants, Biologic agents, Phototherapy

Impetigo.description: Impetigo is a highly contagious bacterial skin infection characterized by red sores that quickly rupture, ooze fluid, and develop a honey-colored crust.
Impetigo.precautions: Keep skin clean and dry, avoid close contact with others, practice good hand hygiene, avoid picking at sores.
Impetigo.medications: Topical antibiotics (e.g., mupirocin), Oral antibiotics (for severe cases)
